title: Lazy load CUDA and THNN modules
body_html: The torch.cuda package can now be loaded even if the pytorch installation isn't build with CUDA support. This is particularly useful for packages that work with CUDA and non-CUDA, because you can do proper Python type checking (isinstance(tensor, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)).
body_text: The torch.cuda package can now be loaded even if the pytorch installation isn't build with CUDA support. This is particularly useful for packages that work with CUDA and non-CUDA, because you can do proper Python type checking (isinstance(tensor, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)).
body: The `torch.cuda` package can now be loaded even if the pytorch installation isn't build with CUDA support. This is particularly useful for packages that work with CUDA and non-CUDA, because you can do proper Python type checking (`isinstance(tensor, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)`).
